title: What are the benefits of learning the Python programming language to an ordinary person? - Quora

response.answer_text: None. Unless you intend to become a programmer, there is no point in learning Python or any other programming language. The vast majority of people in our society do not know how to program. They’re doing just fine. Moreover, the vast majority have absolutely no interest in learning how to program. There are only 3 reasons to learn programming: pursue a professional goalas a hobbyout of curiosityMost people aren’t that curious. Most people have other professions. The world doesn’t need 100 million programmers.

If you are a ordinary person then by learning python, you will understand how a computer follows instructions given by piece of code. You will get to learn Various Logics required to achieve certain Functionalities. You will Develop Problem Solving Attitude. Endless opportunities will knock your doors such as AI, ML, Ethical Hacking etc. Overall if you want to dive in into the future of technology then your first answer is python.

Perhaps automating boring/repetitive tasks an ordinary person might carry out on their computer. There is an introductory Python text entitled Automate the Boring Stuff With Python. The content is free online: Automate the Boring Stuff with Python Basically using Python as a scripting language, a more capable option than bash or perhaps PowerShell… Bash (Unix shell) - Wikipedia PowerShell - Wikipedia
